# Sherwin-Williams Company (SHW) - Comprehensive Analysis Report

## 1. Company Overview

The Sherwin-Williams Company engages in the development, manufacture, distribution, and sale of paint, coatings, and related products to professional, industrial, commercial and retail customers. As of 2024, it is the largest coatings company in the world by revenue. Founded by Henry Sherwin and Edward Williams in Cleveland in 1866, the company operates through three segments: The Paint Stores Group, Consumer Brands Group, and Performance Coatings Group.

It operates through three segments: Paint Stores Group, Consumer Brands Group, and Performance Coatings Group. The company operates in more than 120 countries and has built a comprehensive portfolio of well-known brands including Sherwin-Williams, Valspar, Dutch Boy, HGTV HOME, Krylon, Minwax, and Thompson's WaterSeal. With a record $23.10 billion in net sales for 2024 and operations spanning over 120 countries, the company's story is one of enduring success and innovation.

## 2. Current Market Data

The latest closing stock price for Sherwin-Williams as of January 12, 2026 is 357.63. The current Sherwin-Williams(SHW) stock price is $357.63, with a market capitalization of 88.66B. The stock trades at a price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio of 34.50 and offers a dividend yield of 89.4%. The stock's 52-week range extends from a low of $308.84 to a high of $379.65.

## 3. Existing Products/Services

The Paint Stores Group segment offers architectural paint and coatings; protective and marine products; and OEM product finishes and related products for architectural and industrial paint contractors, and do-it-yourself homeowners under the Sherwin-Williams brand. The Consumer Brands Group segment supplies a portfolio of branded and private-label architectural paints, stains, varnishes, industrial products, wood finishes products, wood preservatives, applicators, corrosion inhibitors, aerosols, caulks, and adhesives to retailers, including home centers and hardware stores, and dedicated dealers and distributors.

The Performance Coatings Group segment develops and sells industrial coatings for wood finishing and general industrial applications; automotive refinish products; protective and marine coatings; coil coatings; packaging coatings; and performance-based resins and colorants. Sherwin-Williams has created more than 35,000 color names for paint over its history, and as of 2023, it has nearly 200 distinct shades of white classified as either warm or cool.

## 4. Planned Products/Services/Projects

The company is committed to innovation with significant R&D investments focusing on eco-friendly coatings, smart coating technologies, and sustainable solutions. That month, the company also began work on a new R&D center in Brecksville, OH. The new headquarters's location was clarified in March 2020, with the company committing to constructing a new building complex, also in Downtown Cleveland. The company continues to develop advanced waterborne and low-VOC coatings to meet environmental regulations and consumer demands for sustainable products.

## 5. Growth Strategy

Sherwin-Williams' growth strategy centers on strategic acquisitions, geographic expansion, and technological innovation. The business is a leading provider of architectural paints in Brazil and had sales of approximately $525 million for the year ended December 31, 2024. The business develops, manufactures and sells a comprehensive portfolio of innovative products under the well-known Suvinil and Glasu! brand names to professional painters, designers, architects, general contractors and consumers across the country. The company employs approximately 1,000 employees and operates two production facilities strategically located in the Northeast and Southeast regions of Brazil.

## 6. Current and Potential Major Clients

The company serves a diverse customer base including professional contractors, industrial customers, do-it-yourself homeowners, and retail channels. The company's scale and reputation mean it is also able make exclusive deals such as the partnership it recently announced with Lowe's (LOW) to be its only nationwide supplier for interior and exterior paints. Major retail partnerships include Lowe's and other home improvement retailers, while the professional contractor market remains a core customer segment through its extensive store network.

Full year 2025 adjusted diluted net income per share guidance in the range of $11.65 to $12.05 per share Given these assumptions, we expect adjusted diluted net income per share will be in the range of $11.65 to $12.05 per share, which represents 4.6% growth from 2024 at the mid-point.

## 8. Headwinds & Tailwinds

**Headwinds:**
- Petz cited housing affordability, inflation and global tariffs for the company's profit slump. She said she expects those economic headwinds to continue into 2026.
- a "very challenging economic environment, affordability issues and elevated mortgage rates have driven housing demand to near historic lows." She also noted that higher inflation has "severely reduced DIY demand" for the third year in a row, adding that global tariff policies have "impacted industrial demand and increased costs."

**Tailwinds:**
- Strong brand recognition and pricing power
- Extensive retail network providing direct customer access
- Growing market share opportunities in a fragmented industry
- Recovery potential in housing and construction markets

## 9. Market Shares

The company has approximately 12% market share in this highly fragmented industry (about 33% share in the U.S.). Sherwin-Williams is the leader in the global paint market, which generated $125 billion in sales in 2017. Sherwin-Williams controls approximately 15% global market share

## 10. Comparison to Competitors

With approximately $18.2 billion in revenue in 2024, PPG Industries, another American multinational, is a strong competitor to Sherwin-Williams. AkzoNobel, headquartered in the Netherlands, ranks third in the global paints and coatings industry by revenue. In 2020, AkzoNobel commanded a 6.9% global market share and is the leading coatings company in Europe, with over 16% market share. With $10.2 billion in revenue, Nippon Paint, a Japanese company, is a major player in the global coatings industry.

## 11. Partnerships, Mergers and Acquisitions

**Recent Major Acquisition:**
The Sherwin-Williams Company (NYSE: SHW) has completed the acquisition of BASF's Brazilian architectural paints business ("Suvinil") following the announcement of a definitive agreement in February of this year and subsequent customary regulatory approvals. Suvinil will become part of the Sherwin-Williams Consumer Brands Group. The purchase price represents a low teens EBITDA multiple following anticipated post transaction synergies net of one-time costs.

**Historic Acquisitions:**
Sherwin-Williams acquired the Valspar Corporation on March 20, 2016, for $11.3 billion. This remains the company's largest acquisition and significantly expanded its global presence and product portfolio.

## 12. Recent Developments

**CFO Transition:**
The Sherwin-Williams Company (NYSE: SHW) announced today that its Board of Directors has elected Benjamin E. Meisenzahl to serve as the Company's next Chief Financial Officer (CFO), effective January 1, 2026. Mr. Meisenzahl, 44, has served as Senior Vice President â€“ Finance for the last two and a half years and brings 22 years of overall Sherwin-Williams experience to his new role. He will assume the CFO duties currently held by Allen J. Mistysyn, 57, who will assume a short-term transition role before retiring after 35 years of dedicated service to the Company.

**401(k) Suspension:**
Sherwin-Williams is cutting its matching contribution to employee retirement accounts as profits continue to decline for the paint company. In an email sent Wednesday to employees, CEO Heidi Petz said the company was temporarily suspending the six percent match to workers' 401k plans.

**Dow Jones Addition:**
In November 2024, the company was added to the Dow Jones Industrial Average. NVIDIA Corp. (NASD:NVDA) will replace Intel Corp. (NASD:INTC), and The Sherwin-Williams Co. (NYSE:SHW) will replace Dow Inc. (NYSE:DOW) in the Dow Jones Industrial Average.

tldr_summary:
Sherwin-Williams Company is the world's largest coatings manufacturer, developing, producing, and distributing paints and related products across 120 countries through three primary business segments: Paint Stores, Consumer Brands, and Performance Coatings.

Key investment considerations include market leadership with approximately 15% global market share, strategic geographic expansion (especially in Latin America), and ongoing innovation in eco-friendly coatings. The company recently joined the Dow Jones Industrial Average and completed a significant acquisition of BASF's Brazilian architectural paints business. Despite current economic headwinds like housing affordability challenges and reduced DIY demand, Sherwin-Williams maintains strong brand recognition, an extensive retail network, and consistent financial performance with record 2024 net sales of $23.10 billion.

The AI analysis rates the stock a "Buy" at 7.3/10, with a fair value estimate of $385-$395, reflecting solid long-term growth potential despite near-term economic uncertainties.
